author: nc1234
content: Why don't we use `beacon_block_root` as opposed to `inclusion_list_committee_root` in `InclusionList` just like `AttestationData` and `SyncCommitteeMessage`? Beacon block root communicates LMD GHOST info which is enough for gossipsub receiver to know whether he and the publisher have the same ILC list

author: terence0083
content: Committee matters the most. If a peer sends us an IL for the same slot but a different committee, for example, based on a very old parent root or a deep fork, we don’t want to process or gossip it. Block root is a stricter version of this and isn’t entirely necessary due to the inclusion list satisfactory check. What we care about is the il_committee, and it seems cleaner to explicitly have (a commitment to) that as part of the IL, removing any ambiguity...

author: nflaig
content: Based on engine api spec `engine_updatePayloadWithInclusionListV1` returns a `payloadId` does this mean the request updates the id? I would assume the EL just modifies an existing payload so the id should be unchanged

author: terence0083
content: I'm happy for changing or not changing.. What do the EL teams prefer here? I think CL teams can adopt to either behavior as long as it's clear

author: nflaig
content: I am asking because we cache payload ids by fcu attributes so would be in favor if we keep the same payload id

author: terence0083
content: ya same here, in our case we just override the cache which is simple, again I dont feel strongly, will leave the decision to you guys

author: jih2nn
content: Current Geth implementation doesn't change the payload ID and returns the same. iirc I made it return the payload ID as it might be changed if the EL takes IL into account when computing the ID.

author: nflaig
content: can do the same but requires passing fcu attributes around

author: terence0083
content: ack, let's keep the id the same then, so we can just remove the return from that end point

author: nflaig
content: at least from current behavior I don't think ELs use txs in block to compute the ID, but if they need a id for book keeping reasons we can reconsider this

author: jih2nn
content: Well, the ID would be computed based on the build parameter (at least in geth and reth), and IL could be one of them. So I think the question would be will there be a case that two different payloads are in building process with the same build parameter except but IL.
